page.title: 17West Wratting: Some Pets
page.content: One of the residents sheep was ill and he was not sure what was wrong with it. This is one of the orphans which he bottle-fed a few winters ago and as a lamb followed him about the house. Now and again a couple of them have to go to market, which makes him a bit sad. He doesn't get much for them, but since he was a shepherd in the war, he has kept a few ewes of his own. Booboo is a tame bantam, who lives a life of luxury compared with the Rhode Island Reds in the pens down the garden. She's the freedom of the flower and vegetable garden and normally lays freely apart from this year. Maybe she doesn't like the chilly weather either. Booboo roosts on the washing machine at night. She strolls in around dusk and a newspaper is provided for her to sleep on.
